ingredients.name: Whiskey
ingredients.description:
Whiskey is a distilled alcoholic beverage made from fermented grain mash. The grains used in whiskey production can include barley, corn, rye, and wheat. The production process involves mashing the grains, fermenting the mash, distilling the liquid, and aging it in wooden barrels, usually made of oak. The aging process imparts flavors and character to the whiskey.

The flavor, aroma, and characteristics of whiskey can vary widely based on factors such as the type of grains used, the distillation process, the type of barrels used for aging, and the duration of maturation. Whiskey is enjoyed in various ways, including neat, on the rocks, or as a key ingredient in cocktails.

ingredients.name: Simple Syrup
ingredients.description: Syrup made with sugar and water. Usually in 1:1 or 2:1 ratio.

ingredients.name: Egg White
ingredients.description: Egg white is the clear liquid part of an egg that surrounds the yolk. It is rich in proteins and is commonly used in cooking and baking for its ability to add structure, foam, and a smooth texture to various dishes.

ingredients.name: Red wine
ingredients.description: Red wine is a type of wine made from dark-colored grape varieties. The color of red wine comes from the skin of the grapes, which is included in the fermentation process. The skins impart color, tannins, and various flavors to the wine. Red wines can range from light and fruity to rich and full-bodied, and they are typically enjoyed at room temperature. Popular red grape varieties include Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Pinot Noir, and Syrah, among others. Red wine is known for its diverse flavor profiles and is often paired with a variety of foods.
